intro: Engelhardia, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to Australia and New Guinea. These plants are characterized by their aromatic leaves and showy, often yellow or orange flowers. Engelhardia species typically grow as shrubs or small trees, and they are adapted to a variety of environmental conditions. Their botanical features make them valuable in horticulture and ecological studies.
